titles: Low-dose semi-coronal CT sacroiliac joints early diagnosis ankylosing spondylitis
abstracts: Background: Imaging modalities essential diagnosis ankylosing spondylitis (AS). Radiographic sacroiliitis requirement  modified New York (mNY) criteria AS disadvantage low sensitivity. MRI advantage detecting active inflammatory lesions criticized low specificity. Computerized tomography (CT) higher diagnostic accuracy radiography detecting structural changes, application limited high radiation dose. The reduction radiation dose achieved decreasing tube current[] previous study demonstrated effective dose (ED) semi-coronal sacroiliac joint (SIJ) CT least six times lower female nearly four times lower male axial SIJ CT[]. Objective(s): To evaluate value low-dose semi-coronal SIJ CT early diagnosis AS. Method(s): Thirty-three patients diagnosed mNY criteria pre-existing axial SIJ CT past two years visible structural damage enrolled. These patients underwent low-dose semi-coronal SIJ CT examination obtained -mm slices,  kV  mAs, gantry tilted -degree cranially. The ED low-dose semi-coronal CT pre-existing conventional axial CT compared. Image qualities low-dose semicoronal CT blind-graded separately  rheumatologists poor, fair, good excellent. And correlation image quality body mass index (BMI) analyzed. The CT scans read blinded manner  rheumatologists trained radiologists. CT scans two groups graded respectively mNY criteria, criteria established Lee[] Innsbruck criteria[]. The kappa coefficient used assess consistency grading two groups. Result(s): Thirty-three patients received low-dose semi-coronal CT examination average ED . mSv, meant % reduction radiation compared pre-existing CT. The quality images male patients BMI< kg/m female patients good excellent. Image qualities assessed poor fair % (/) male patients whose BMI> kg/m. There significant negative correlation image quality BMI (r=-.,P=.). The grading low-dose semi-coronal CT showed differences compared pre-existing CT mNY criteria (see below). For two classification criteria, consistency grading two groups satisfactory (kappa=. Lee criteria; kappa=. Innsbruck criteria; P>.). Conclusion(s): The radiation dose low-dose semi-coronal SIJ CT reduced significantly compared conventional axial SIJ CT acceptable diagnostic efficacy. (Figure Presented).

titles: Radiation-induced malignancies intensity-modulated versus conventional mediastinal radiotherapy small animal model
abstracts: A long-standing hypothesis radiotherapy intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT) increases risk second cancer due low-dose exposure large volumes normal tissue. Therefore, young patients still treated conventional techniques rather modern IMRT. We challenged hypothesis first-of-its-kind experiments using animal model. Cancer-prone Tp+/CX knockout rats received mediastinal irradiation x xGy using volumetric-modulated arc therapy (VMAT, advanced IMRT) conventional anterior-posterior/posterior-anterior (AP/PA) beams using non-irradiated rats controls (n=/group, ntotal=). Tumors assigned volumes receiving -%, -%, -%, <% target dose characterized histology loss-of-heterozygosity (LOH). Irradiated rats predominantly developed lymphomas sarcomas areas receiving -% (n=) rather -% (n=) target dose. Latency significantly shortened xGy vs. controls (p<.). The frequency (/ vs. /; p=.) latency ( vs.  days; p=.) radiation-associated tumors similar VMAT vs. AP/PA. LOH strongly associated sarcoma treatment. The support hypothesis IMRT increases risk second cancer. Thus current practice withholding dose-sparing IMRT young patients may need re-evaluated.

titles: Baseline MAPK signaling activity confers intrinsic radioresistance KRAS-mutant colorectal carcinoma cells rapid upregulation heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein K (hnRNP K)
abstracts: Heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein K (hnRNP K) overexpressed malignant tumors involved DNA damage response upon ionizing radiation (IR). Here, investigate role radioresistance colorectal carcinoma (CRC) evaluate pharmacological approach enhance CRC radiosensitivity via downregulation hnRNP K. We show hnRNP K overexpressed CRC tissue specimens upregulated response IR vitro, occurs faster KRAS-mutant CRC cells. HnRNP K knockdown impairs cell survival, cell cycle progression KRAS-dependent radioresistance increases apoptosis. Using chicken chorioallantoic membrane assay, decrease xenograft tumor growth radioresistance upon hnRNP K depletion could verified vivo, comparable effects achieved suppression hnRNP K expression using MEK inhibitor MEK (Binimetinib). In summary, KRAS-mutant CRC shows intrinsic radioresistance along rapid upregulation hnRNP K response IR effectively targeted MEK inhibition. Our point towards possible use MAPK pathway inhibitors decrease radioresistance KRAS-mutant CRC via downregulation hnRNP K.Copyright ©  Elsevier Ireland Ltd

titles: Effect proton-pump inhibitors risk lower gastrointestinal bleeding associated NSAIDs, aspirin, clopidogrel, warfarin
abstracts: BACKGROUND: We investigated effects proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) lower gastrointestinal bleeding (LGIB) interactions nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), low-dose aspirin, clopidogrel, warfarin LGIB risk., METHODS: We prospectively studied  patients emergently hospitalized LGIB , nonbleeding patients. All patients underwent colonoscopy. Smoking, alcohol drinking, drug exposure, Charlson comorbidity index score assessed colonoscopy. Adjusted odds ratios (AOR) LGIB estimated., RESULTS: LGIB significantly associated older age, higher comorbidity index, NSAID, aspirin, clopidogrel, warfarin use. PPI use significantly associated older age, male sex, current alcohol drinker, higher comorbidity index, NSAID, aspirin, clopidogrel, warfarin, acetaminophen, corticosteroid use. Multivariate analysis adjusted confounding factors revealed LGIB significantly associated PPI use (AOR .;  % confidence interval .-.; p = .), specifically omeprazole (AOR .; p = .), esomeprazole (AOR .; p = .), lansoprazole (AOR .; p = .), rabeprazole (AOR .; p = .). In interaction model, significant interactions observed PPIs NSAIDs (AOR .; p = .), aspirin (AOR .; p = .), clopidogrel (AOR ., p = .), warfarin (AOR .; p = .)., CONCLUSIONS: This large case-control study demonstrated PPI use lead increased risk LGIB, regardless type PPI used. Further, LGIB risk affected PPI use, irrespective concomitant therapy NSAIDs, low-dose aspirin, clopidogrel, warfarin.

titles: Bowel preparation intravenous urography: necessary?
abstracts: Whether bowel preparation used intravenous urography (IVU) remains controversial issue. Despite strongly held views sides little scientific evidence support either viewpoint. We conducted prospective randomized study designed test hypothesis adequate bowel preparation IVU facilitates better quality studies requiring fewer films consequently less time lower radiation exposure. Data  patients analysed;  patients received bowel preparation  received bowel preparation. There difference groups terms number films taken, duration procedure, visibility renal tracts overall quality studies. The prepared group significantly less faecal residue unprepared group. However, renal tract visibility greater, combination gas haustral folds seen bowel preparation obscured fine detail urinary tract effectively faecal residue. The hypothesis adequate bowel preparation IVU facilitates better quality studies must therefore rejected.

abstracts: INTRODUCTION: Shoulder arthroplasty modernized Neer al proximal humerus fracture shown excellent outcome. Despite clinical success, complications occur. Neurological injury rare complication estimated incidence % %. Here would like report uncommon complication radial nerve palsy hence discuss possible causes preventive measures. CASE REPORT: Mr X,  year old gentleman, right hand dominant works office clerk, presented  parts fracture proximal right humerus anterior shoulder following motor-vehicle accident (Figure ). He underwent shoulder hemiarthroplasty  weeks post-trauma. Procedure performed interscalene regional block standard delto-pectoral approach. The displaced humeral head button hole pectoralis major muscle removed carefully direct visualization. No complication occurred intra-operatively. Shoulder x-ray showed well-placed, cemented humeral stem arthroplasty (Figure ). On post-operative evaluation, patient clinical evidence complete radial nerve palsy; else peripheral nerves intact. This initially attributed residual effects interscalene block. However discharge post-operative day , improvement. DISCUSSION: Complications related shoulder implant arthroplasty well documented. Incidence complications approached %. These include instability, rotator cuff tear, ectopic ossification, glenoid loosening, intraoperative fracture, nerve injury, infection humeral loosening. No vascular injury reported. Most cases nerve injury neuropraxia involving axillary nerve, musculocutaneous nerve, median ulnar nerves. titles: Lung cancer mortality among uranium gaseous diffusion plant workers: A cohort study -
abstracts: Background: %-% lung cancers attributable occupational exposures. Reports disparate regarding elevated lung cancer mortality risk among workers employed uranium gaseous diffusion plants. Objective(s): To investigate whether external radiation exposure associated lung cancer mortality risk among uranium gaseous diffusion workers. Method(s): A cohort  nuclear industry workers employed   Paducah uranium gaseous diffusion plant (PGDP) assembled. A job-specific exposure matrix (JEM) used determine likely toxic metal exposure categories. In addition, radiation film badge dosimeters used monitor cumulative external ionizing radiation exposure. International Classification Disease (ICD) codes   used identify  lung cancer deaths. Logistic proportional hazards regression used estimate lung cancer mortality risk. Result(s): Lung cancer mortality risk elevated among workers experienced external radiation >. mrem employment duration > years. Conclusion(s): Employees uranium gaseous diffusion plants carry higher risk lung cancer mortality; mortality associated increased radiation exposure duration employment.

abstracts: BACKGROUND: As validated tools identify treatment-related adverse events across cancer care settings, sought develop oncology-specific [']triggers['] flag potential adverse events among cancer patients using claims data., METHODS:   adult patients undergoing initial course cancer-directed therapy breast, colorectal, lung, prostate cancer   drawn large commercial claims database. We defined  oncology-specific triggers using diagnosis procedure codes. To distinguish treatment-related complications comorbidities, required logical temporal relationship treatment associated trigger. We tabulated prevalence triggers cancer type metastatic status -year follow-up, examined cancer trigger risk factors., RESULTS: Cancer-specific trigger events affected % patients initial treatment year. The trigger burden varied disease metastatic status, % patients nonmetastatic prostate cancer % % metastatic colorectal lung cancers, respectively. The prevalent triggers abnormal serum bicarbonate, blood transfusion, non-contrast chest CT scan following radiation therapy, hypoxemia. Among patients metastatic disease, % one trigger event % two more. Triggers common among older patients, women, non-whites, patients low family incomes, without college education., CONCLUSIONS: Oncology-specific triggers offer promising method identifying potential patient safety events among patients across cancer care settings. titles: Capacity primary hospitals diabetes treatment six Chinese provinces: A cross-sectional survey
abstracts: Background Establishment hierarchical medical system one major tasks outlined China's ambitious health reform, ultimate success system depends treatment capacity primary hospitals. titles: GUCYC signaling opposes acute radiation-induced GI syndrome
abstracts: High doses ionizing radiation induce acute damage epithelial cells gastrointestinal (GI) tract, mediating toxicities restricting therapeutic efficacy radiation cancer morbidity mortality nuclear disasters. No approved prophylaxis therapy exists toxicities, part reflecting incomplete understanding mechanisms contributing acute radiation-induced GI syndrome (RIGS). Guanylate cyclase C (GUCYC) hormones guanylin uroguanylin recently emerged one paracrine axis defending intestinal mucosal integrity mutational, chemical, inflammatory injury. Here, reveal role GUCYC paracrine axis compensatory mechanisms opposing RIGS. Eliminating GUCYC signaling exacerbated RIGS, amplifying radiation-induced mortality, weight loss, mucosal bleeding, debilitation, intestinal dysfunction. Durable expression GUCYC, guanylin, uroguanylin mRNA protein intestinal epithelial cells preserved following lethal irradiation inducing RIGS. Oral delivery heat-stable enterotoxin (ST), exogenous GUCYC ligand, opposed RIGS, process requiring p activation mediated dissociation MDM. In turn, p activation prevented cell death selectively limiting mitotic catastrophe, apoptosis. These studies reveal role GUCYC paracrine hormone axis novel compensatory mechanism opposing RIGS, highlight potential oral GUCYC agonists (Linzess; Trulance) prevent treat RIGS cancer therapy nuclear disasters.Copyright © AACR.

titles: Review: Mucosal melanoma head neck
abstracts: Head neck mucosal melanoma (MM) rare aggressive neoplasm, high rates local, regional, distant failure. Owing small size reported series retrospective nature, lack uniform comprehensive staging system, effect various treatment strategies disease control survival difficult assess. The optimal management head neck MM well defined. Surgical treatment advocated primary treatment modality, growing consideration postoperative radiotherapy, wide surgical resection head neck region often difficult. Radiotherapy recently reported beneficial management modality, regardless fact MM considered radioresistant. As significant morbidity expected high doses radiotherapy head neck region, new radiographic modalities better precision required. Furthermore, high-energy radiotherapy suggested better therapy mucosal MM due suggested biology tumor. The high rates locoregional recurrence distant metastasis also suggest systemic treatment needed. Currently, role adjuvant systemic therapy patients successfully resected, recent developments understanding biology melanoma and, particular, specific growth pathways holds promise future. We strongly recommend evaluation role chemotherapy immunotherapy decrease rates distant metastasis improve survival. ©  Wolters Kluwer Health Lippincott Williams & Wilkins.

abstracts: BACKGROUND: Orthotopic liver transplantation (OLT) treatment option early-stage hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). OLT often associated high blood loss, requiring blood transfusion. titles: Effects Far-Infrared Therapy Foot Circulation Among Hemodialysis Patients With Diabetes Mellitus
abstracts: BACKGROUND: Far-infrared radiation (FIR) therapy improves vessel dilation, circulation, vessel endothelial function, angiogenesis reduces atherosclerosis. However, evidence FIR therapy's effects foot circulation among diabetic patients undergoing hemodialysis scarce., AIM: To determine whether FIR therapy improves foot circulation diabetic patients undergoing hemodialysis., DESIGN: Quasi-experimental., METHODS: In June November , diabetic patients undergoing hemodialysis (N = ) hemodialysis center northern Taiwan divided two groups: experimental group (n = ) received FIR therapy bilateral dorsalis pedis artery ( min/session,  times/week  months) control group (n = ) received conventional dialysis care. Paired test, independent samples test, two-proportion Z test, repeated-measures analysis covariance performed compare changes baseline end -month groups., RESULTS: Significant positive effects FIR therapy temperature, pulse, blood flow dorsalis pedis artery observed. Sensitivity pain, tactility, pressure also improved significantly experimental group. The Edinburgh Claudication Questionnaire revealed experimental group reductions subjective experiences soreness, tingling, coldness feet., CONCLUSION: The findings significant improvements objective subjective blood flow neural function experimental group indicate FIR therapy improves blood circulation feet. This therapy thus great potential effective adjuvant treatment patients diabetes mellitus undergoing hemodialysis.

titles: Noonan syndrome glioneuronal tumors: A central nervous system cancer predisposition association?
abstracts: BACKGROUND: Noonan syndrome (NS) associated germline Ras signaling pathway mutations, RAS overactivation increased tumorigenesis risk. Rosette-forming glioneuronal tumors (RFGT) rare indolent tumors. We report molecular profiling two patients NS RFGT. PATIENT : A -year-old male NS diagnosed RFGT partial tumor resection followed focal irradiation. He enrolled comprehensive genomic profiling study involving paired tumor-normal whole exome sequencing RNA sequencing disease-involved tissue, revealing germline PTPN alteration (p.GlyAla) consistent NS, somatic deletion (p.Ile-Thrdel) PIKR somatic variant (p.LysGlu) FGFR concomitant increased expression PIKR FGFR RNA-sequencing. The patient remains without tumor progression nine months since irradiation. PATIENT : A -year-old male persistent headaches, underwent brain MRI demonstrated multiple abnormal signals pineal region midbrain. He stereotactic biopsy revealing RFGT. He enrolled genomic study revealing germline PTPN alteration (p.AsnAsp) resulting new diagnosis NS. Several family members subsequently identified clinical features NS, including mother two siblings, enabling appropriate counseling. Two somatic variants found trans PIKR (p.Thr-Phedel p.Glu-AsndelinsAsp), somatic variant (p.ValMet) FGFR, resultant overexpression PIKR. The patient monitored surveillance imaging. CONCLUSION(S): We report molecular profiling two patients NS RFGT; strongly suggesting connection RASopathies overactivation MAPK PIK/AKT/mTOR signaling pathways.

titles: Adjuvant external beam radiation medullary thyroid carcinoma
abstracts: Background: Adjuvant radiation rarely used treat medullary thyroid carcinoma (MTC). We hypothesized external beam radiation therapy (EBRT) would improve overall survival (OS) MTC patients. Method(s): The Surveillance, Epidemiology, End Results (SEER) database identified patients underwent total thyroidectomy lymph nodes excision MTC  . The Kaplan-Meier method used univariate comparisons OS. Multivariate Cox proportional hazards models controlled gender, age, lymph node status, tumor size, extent disease, EBRT. Result(s): After  years, EBRT significantly improve OS (log rank, P < .). In node-positive patients, univariate analysis demonstrated OS benefit EBRT (log rank, P < .). In multivariate model node-positive patients, increasing age (P < .) tumor size (P < .) significantly influenced OS. Conclusion(s): The OS benefit attributed EBRT node-positive patients univariate analysis could duplicated controlling known prognostic factors. ©  Wiley-Liss, Inc.

We assessed safety tolerability phototherapy (PT) MLu patients undergoing percutaneous coronary stent deployment., METHODS AND RESULTS: An open-label, phase I, drug light dose-escalation clinical trial MLu PT enrolled  patients undergoing de novo coronary stent deployment. titles: Proton versus photon craniospinal irradiation hematologic malignancies involving CNS: Effectiveness toxicity stem cell transplant
abstracts: Purpose/Objective(s): Craniospinal irradiation (CSI) improves local control leukemia lymphoma CNS involvement. However, adult patients anticipating subsequent autologous allogeneic stem cell transplant (SCT), cumulative acute organ neurotoxicity concern, CSI fields extensive salvage therapy SCT conditioning regimens also toxic. We compared toxicity profiles outcomes patients receiving proton vs. photon CSI prior SCT. Materials/Methods: We identified  consecutive patients (age>) treated institution CSI hematologic malignancy CNS involvement -. Of these,  patients received CSI prior SCT using proton photon technique. Outcomes compared CSI technique, including: acute toxicities CSI SCT admission plus  days, long-term neurotoxicity, disease response, overall survival. We compared proton vs. photon CSI using Fisher's exact test Wilcoxon rank sum test. Result(s): In  patients, % received proton % photon CSI, CNS involvement ALL (%), AML (%), CLL (%), CML (%), lymphoma (%) myeloma (%) (PZ., difference CSI technique). Allogeneic SCT used % patients, % st nd complete remission SCT. Myeloablative conditioning used %. CSI used consolidation % treat gross CNS disease % (PZ., difference). Median radiation dose (range) was:  Gy (.-.) protons  Gy (.-) photons (PZ.). By CSI technique, acute mucositis risks differed: Lower rates RTOG Grade - mucositis occurred proton CSI compared photon CSI (% vs. %, P=.;  Grade  protons vs.  Grade ,  Grade ,  Grade  photons). No differences CSI technique observed, including infection (%) GI (%) toxicity. No toxicity differences CSI technique apparent SCT admission, including mucositis (%), infection (%), acute graft vs. host disease (%); SCT, including severe neurotoxicity characterized diffuse demyelination (%). No differences found admission median length stay ( days) ICU use (%). Successful engraftment occurred % patients (PZ., difference). Forty-seven percent patients ultimately progressed died, one patient CNS relapse last follow-up (PZ., difference). Conclusion(s): In cohort, CSI offered excellent local control CNSinvolved hematologic malignancies pre-SCT setting. Proton CSI demonstrated improved acute mucositis profile radiation course subsequently, comparable peri-transplant long-term toxicity disease outcomes compared photon CSI.

titles: Supermicrosurgical lymphaticovenous anastomosis patient breast lymphedema secondary breast cancer treatment
abstracts: Breast lymphedema (BLE) reported complication following breast cancer treatment. titles: A Retrospective Review Re-irradiating Patients' Recurrent High-grade Gliomas
abstracts: Aims: After radical treatment, high-grade gliomas (HGG) recur locally. Upon recurrence, standard treatment exists. Options include re-resection, salvage systemic therapy re-irradiation. This retrospective study evaluated patients underwent re-irradiation recurrent HGGs assessed prognostic factors influence management. Material(s) Method(s): Eighty-two patients underwent re-irradiation HGG   retrospectively identified. Re-irradiation consisted either standard three-dimensional conformal, intensity-modulated radiotherapy highly conformal stereotactic radiotherapy using mostly volumetric modulated arc therapy. Patient survival re-irradiation primary end point. Survival estimated via Kaplan-Meier method differences assessed using Log-rank test; hazard ratios estimated using Cox regression analysis. Result(s): The median overall survival re-irradiation . months. Re-irradiation, median dose  Gy  fractions, well tolerated: % developed grade  toxicity, patients experienced grade >= radionecrosis. In multivariate analysis, factors significantly associated increased survival included: longer duration initial radiotherapy, better performance status re-irradiation - versus >=, unifocal versus multifocal recurrence higher total re-irradiation dose (>= Gy versus < Gy). Re-resection, salvage systemic therapy age unrelated survival. Conclusion(s): Patients recurrent HGG tolerated re-irradiation well minimal toxicity. Those patients good prognostic groups, including good performance status achieve durable control, suggesting managing patients regular magnetic resonance imaging surveillance post-radical treatment, identifying early radiological progression instituting salvage therapy performance status best.Copyright ©  The Royal College Radiologists

titles: Safety Feasibility Performing Fenestrated Endovascular Abdominal Aneurysm Repair Using Portable C-arm Without Fusion Technology: A Single-Center Experience
abstracts: Objective Most centers performing fenestrated endovascular aneurysm repair (F-EVAR) use hybrid rooms fusion technology mapping. We present experience successfully performing F-EVAR using C-arm without fusion technology. Methods During period January  October , data collected prospectively maintained F-EVAR database tertiary care institute. The primary endpoint technical success, secondary outcomes measured short- midterm clinical success (both defined Society Vascular Surgery reporting standards), blood loss, radiation dose, operative time, postoperative endoleaks, aneurysm rupture, endograft patency, complications. Results We performed  F-EVARs study period five (.%) males six (.%) females, mean age + years. All procedures performed general anesthesia using OEC  Elite Mobile C-arm (GE Healthcare, Chicago, IL, USA) without use fusion technology. Three patients planned preoperative open procedures access due prior cutdown bypass. Technical success achieved  (%) cases. The mean length stay + days, mean follow-up .+. months. The mean procedure time + minutes, mean blood loss + mL. Mean fluoroscopy time + minutes, mean radiation exposure time ,+ mGy. No patients required intraoperative transfusion. Thirty-day (short term) clinical success achieved  (.%), cases whereas six-month (midterm) clinical success achieved  (.%) patients. Branch vessel patency  (%)  days  (.%) six months, primary endograft patency % () six months. We perioperative mortality major adverse cardiac event  days. Thirty-day postoperative morbidity included readmission pulmonary edema cardiac failure one patient. Two patients clinically insignificant silent cardiac enzyme elevation. Three patients re-interventions performed mean follow-up period. Two patients developed renal stent thrombosis resulting renal insufficiency, defined increase creatinine concentration >=. mg/dL, without need dialysis. One type II endoleak identified postoperatively required trans-lumbar embolization. No type I III endoleaks identified study period. Asymptomatic common femoral artery thrombosis seen follow-up imaging one patient. Conclusions We conclude F-EVAR safely performed using C-arm without use fusion technology. Its utility expanded centers appropriate skill set hybrid technology. Copyright © , Juneja et al.

titles: Malignancy arising seborrheic keratosis: report two cases

Histologically, malignancies identified invasive well-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma Bowen's disease (squamous carcinoma situ), respectively. Pre-existing seborrheic keratoses demonstrating zone transition malignant foci present. titles: Toxicological evaluation methacrylic acid copolymers synthesized gamma radiation
abstracts: Two copolymers methacrylic acid -ethylhexyl acrylate ratios :, : synthesized gamma radiation polymerization technique. The following acute toxicity biological reactivity tests carried polymers: (a) Systemic Injection Test, (b) Intracutaneous Test, (c) Dermal Irritation Test, (d) Implantation Test, (e) RBC Hemolysis Test, (f) Agar Diffusion Test, (g) Direct Contact Test (h) Elution Test. The tests revealed copolymers devoid acute toxicity biological reactivity.

titles: A transgene-based, embryo-specific lethality system insect pest management
abstracts: Biological approaches insect pest management offer alternatives pesticidal control. In area-wide control programs cover entire regions, sterile insect technique (SIT) used successfully suppress economically important pest species mass release sterilized pest organisms. However, conventional sterilization ionizing radiation reduces insect fitness, result reduced competitiveness sterilized insects. Here report transgene-based, dominant embryonic lethality system allows generation large quantities competitive sterile insects without need irradiation. The system involves ectopic expression hyperactive pro-apoptotic gene causes embryo-specific lethality driven tetracycline-controlled transactivator (tTA) regulation cellularization gene enhancer-promoter. We successfully tested system Drosophila melanogaster. The embryonic lethality suppressed maternally, allow combined transgenic female-specific lethality systems raise vigorous sterile males.

titles: Identification novel mutation ATPA associated complicated form hereditary spastic paraplegia
abstracts: Objective To establish molecular diagnosis family complicated form autosomal recessive hereditary spastic paraplegia intellectual disability, cognitive decline, psychosis, peripheral neuropathy, upward gaze palsy, thin corpus callosum (TCC). Methods Physical examinations, laboratory tests, structural neuroimaging studies, exome sequence analysis carried out. Results The  patients exhibited intellectual disability progressive intellectual decline accompanied psychiatric symptoms. Gait difficulty spasticity pyramidal weakness appeared ages s-s. Brain MRI revealed TCC atrophic changes frontotemporal lobes, caudate nuclei, cerebellum. Exome sequence analysis revealed novel homozygous c.C>A (p. AlaAsp) variant ATPA, gene responsible complicated form hereditary spastic paraplegia (SPG), Kufor-Rakeb syndrome, neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis. The predominant clinical presentations patients include progressive intellectual disability gait difficulty spasticity pyramidal weakness, consistent diagnosis SPG. Of note, prominent psychiatric symptoms extrapyramidal signs including rigidity, dystonia, involuntary movements preceded spastic paraparesis. Conclusions Our study broadens clinical spectrum associated ATPA mutations.Copyright ©  The Author(s).

abstracts: This study aimed detect, analyze, correlate clinical characteristics, blood coagulation functions, blood calcium levels, inflammatory factors patients mild severe COVID- infections. The enrolled COVID- infected patients Wuhan Jin Yin-tan Hospital ( cases, Wuhan, China), Suzhou Infectious Disease Hospital ( cases, Suzhou, China), Xuzhou Infectious Disease Hospital ( cases, Xuzhou, China). After admission, basic information collected; X-ray chest CT images obtained; data routine blood tests, liver kidney function, myocardial enzymes, electrolytes, blood coagulation function, (erythrocyte sedimentation rate) ESR, C-reactive protein (CRP), IL-, procalcitonin (PCT), calcitonin, laboratory tests obtained. The patients grouped according clinical classification method based pneumonia diagnosis treatment plan new coronavirus infection (trial version ) China. The mild ( cases) severe cases ( cases) compared analyzed. Most COVID- patients presented fever. Chest X-ray CT images showed multiple patchy ground glass opacities lungs COVID  infected patients, especially patients severe cases. Compared patients mild infection, patients severe infection older (p = .) significant increase AST BUN. The levels CK, LDH, CK-MB, proBNP, Myo patients severe COVID- infection also increased significantly compared patients mild cases. Patients severe COVID- infections presented coagulation dysfunction increased D-dimer fibrin degradation product (FDP) levels. Severe COVID- patients low serum calcium ion (Ca+) concentrations high calcitonin PCT levels exhibited serious systemic inflammation. Ca+ COVID- patients significantly negatively correlated PCT, calcitonin, D-dimer, PFDP, ESR, CRP IL-. D-dimer COVID- patients significantly positively correlated CRP IL-. In conclusion, patients severe COVID- infection presented significant metabolic dysfunction abnormal blood coagulation, sharp increase inflammatory factors calcitonin procalcitonin levels, significant decrease Ca+. Decreased Ca+ coagulation dysfunction COVID- patients significantly correlated inflammatory factors.© Copyright ©  Qi, Kong, Ding, Wu, Ji, Huang, Li, Wang, Wen, Wu, Wu, Huang, Li, Liu Tang.

titles: A Small Peptide Ac-SDKP Inhibits Radiation-Induced Cardiomyopathy
abstracts: BACKGROUND: Advances radiotherapy thoracic cancers resulted improvement survival. However, radiation exposure heart induce cardiotoxicity. No therapy currently available inhibit untoward effects. We examined whether small tetrapeptide, N-acetyl-Ser-Asp-Lys-Pro (Ac-SDKP), counteract radiation-induced cardiotoxicity inhibiting macrophage-dependent inflammatory fibrotic pathways. METHODS AND RESULTS: After characterizing rat model cardiac irradiation magnetic resonance imaging protocols, examined effects Ac-SDKP radiation-induced cardiomyopathy. We treated rats Ac-SDKP  weeks. We compared myocardial contractile function extracellular matrix cardiac magnetic resonance imaging extent inflammation, fibrosis, Mac- (galectin-) release tissue analyses. Because Mac- crucial macrophage-derived mediator fibrosis, performed studies determine Mac- synthesis macrophages response radiation, change profibrotic responses Mac- gene depleted cardiac fibroblasts radiation. Cardiac irradiation diminished myocardial contractile velocities enhanced extracellular matrix deposition. This accompanied macrophage infiltration, fibrosis, cardiomyocyte apoptosis, cardiac Mac- expression. Ac-SDKP strongly inhibited detrimental effects. Ac-SDKP migrated perinuclear cytoplasm macrophages inhibited radiation-induced Mac- release. Cardiac fibroblasts lacking Mac- gene showed reduced transforming growth factor beta, collagen I, collagen III expression radiation exposure. CONCLUSION(S): Our study identifies novel cardioprotective effects Ac-SDKP model cardiac irradiation. These protective effects exerted inhibiting inflammation, fibrosis, reducing macrophage activation. This study shows therapeutic potential endogenously released peptide counteract radiation-induced cardiomyopathy.

abstracts: The postnatal development sensory systems shown studies last four decades influenced experience critical periods development. Animals flown space placed water day landing maintained head forelimbs balanced posture. However, animals began swim, hindquarters showed little lateral postural control resulting rotation longitudinal axis ( degrees+/- deg). Such suggest 'unlinking' postural control forequarters hindquarters early hours landing. Similar instability seen animals age-matched day launch (+/- deg) ground control animals (+/- deg) corrected within one two rotations, even absence swimming. Animals flown space began swim sooner placed water, duration swimming strokes shorter control animals. Motion analysis revealed difference swimming style landing day. In flight animals, knee joint flexed throughout stroke, narrower range movement, linear velocity tip foot faster throughout stroke age-matched control animals. Thus, posture water well swimming speed style altered animals flown space. Some characteristics persisted long animals followed ( days). These included short pre-swimming interval short stroke duration flight animals. These findings clearly show altered gravitational field influences postnatal development motor function. The nature differences animals reared space  days remaining ground reflects adaptation flight animals microgravity environment. The data suggest fundamental adaptations resetting basic motor rhythm higher frequency.
